com.ibm.async_util.locks

Interface AsyncSemaphore

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FairAsyncSemaphore

    public interface AsyncSemaphore
    An asynchronously acquirable counting semaphore

    Implementations will specify whether their permit acquisition and release is fair or not; this interface does not define this requirement.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default CompletionStage<Void> acquire()
      Acquires 1 permit from the semaphore as if by calling acquire(long) with an argument of 1.

      Releases the given number of permits to the semaphore.

      Attempts to acquire 1 permit from the semaphore as if by calling tryAcquire(long) with an argument of 1.
      boolean tryAcquire(long permits)
      Attempt to acquire the given number of permits from the semaphore, returning a boolean indicating whether all of the permits were immediately available and have been exclusively acquired.

    • Method Detail

      • acquire

        CompletionStage<Void> acquire(long permits)
        Acquires the given number of permits from the semaphore, returning a future which will complete when all of the permits are exclusively acquired.

        If the permits are available immediately, the returned future may be already complete (but need not be).

        If the permits are not available immediately, the acquisition will enter a queue and an incomplete future will be returned. Semantics of the waiter queue, including ordering policies, are implementation specific and will be defined by the given implementing class. The returned future will complete when sufficient permits have been released and assigned to this acquisition by the governing queue policy.

        Parameters:
        permits - A positive number of permits to acquire from the semaphore
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the requested permits are not positive, or exceed any restrictions enforced by the given implementation

      • release

        void release(long permits)
        Releases the given number of permits to the semaphore.

        If there are unfulfilled acquires pending, this method will release permits to the waiting acquisitions based on the implementation's release and acquire policies. Consequently, this method may complete a number of waiting futures and execute the corresponding observers.

        Parameters:
        permits - A positive number of permits to release to the semaphore
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the released permits are not positive, or exceed any restrictions enforced by the given implementation

      • tryAcquire

        boolean tryAcquire(long permits)
        Attempt to acquire the given number of permits from the semaphore, returning a boolean indicating whether all of the permits were immediately available and have been exclusively acquired.

        Implementations may define precise behavior of this method with respect to competing acquisitions, e.g. whether permits may be acquired while other acquisitions are waiting. This interface only requires that this method will succeed when the given permits are available and there are no other acquisitions queued.

        Parameters:
        permits - A positive number of permits to acquire from the semaphore
        Returns:
        true iff all of the requested permits are available, and have been immediately acquired
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the requested permits are not positive, or exceed any restrictions enforced by the given implementation

      • drainPermits

        long drainPermits()
        Acquires all permits that are immediately available.

        After this call -- provided there are no intermediate releases -- any attempt to acquire will queue and any tryAcquire will fail.

        Returns:
        the number of permits that were available and have been drained

      • getAvailablePermits

        long getAvailablePermits()
        Returns the number of currently available permits.

        The bounds of the returned value are not defined; an implementation may, for example, choose to represent waiting acquisitions as holding negative permits, and thus the value returned by this method could be negative. Furthermore, a positive number of permits returned by this method may not indicate that such permits are acquirable, as the waiter-queue policy may prohibit fulfilling further acquisitions.

        This value is produced on a best-effort basis, and should not be used for any control logic. Generally it is only useful in testing, debugging, or statistics purposes.

      • getQueueLength

        int getQueueLength()
        Returns the number of unfulfilled acquisitions waiting on this semaphore's permits.

        This value is produced on a best-effort basis, and should not be used for any control logic. Generally it is only useful in testing, debugging, or statistics purposes.

      • acquire

        default CompletionStage<Void> acquire()
        Acquires 1 permit from the semaphore as if by calling acquire(long) with an argument of 1.
        See Also:
        acquire(long)

      • release

        default void release()
        Releases 1 permit from the semaphore as if by calling release(long) with an argument of 1.
        See Also:
        release(long)

      • tryAcquire

        default boolean tryAcquire()
        Attempts to acquire 1 permit from the semaphore as if by calling tryAcquire(long) with an argument of 1.
        See Also:
        tryAcquire(long)
